div1.p: Hench discusses the 1900-1901 Signal Corps photographs.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lloyd D. LeMan, January 6, 1942
div1.opener:
OCSigo 004.511
(1-3-42)
January 6, 1942
Room 3023
Muneten Bldg
Contest due & 20 st
entrance
Ref 6700
signal confe-
ext 3879
Major Lloyd D. LeMan
War Department
Office of the Chief Signal Officer
Washington, D. C.
My dear Major LeMan:
div1.p:
I greatly appreciate your January 3 reply to
my letter of December 30, indicating that I will be able
to inspect the photographic files of the Signal Corps
to see what photographs you have which were taken in and
around Havana, particularly at Camp Columbia, Columbia
Barracks and at Camp Lazear in the years 1900 and 1901.

I intend to arrive in Washington about January
13 and will be there three or four days. My Washington
address will be the Willard Hotel.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
